title: Extremely useful app
comment: Very configurable and yet simple.

title: It works
comment: It would be better if it did not star out what I type. If someone's looking over my shoulder, I will deal with that.

title: Makes good passwords
comment: The passwords made here (now) match the ones made with PasswordMaker add-on in FireFox.  what?  Nothing changed, and PasswordmakerX also makes the same passwords.  Were android hash libraries broken, but now fixed?  I am also experiencing the decreasing Leet-minus-1 bug.  How do I see the response to my previous review?!?  Dammit Google!  :-(  . . . . . . . . . . . . . The fact at the source code is on github makes me feel good using this.  Thanks!  Needs DARK theme.  ;-)

Read more information about this at http://passwordmaker.org, it goes pretty deep into the how it works.  Assuming no major flaws in the current standard hash algorithms (like sha256) it should be pretty safe.  As they are designed to be one-way functions.  Read the faq as well on the site.  Feel free to post questions on the github issue tracker.

title: Works perfect now! Lollipop Nexus 5
comment: Previous problems now fixed!  Able to generate passwords ok. Able to save settings. Favorites are a nice feature. Thank you!

title: leet minus 1
comment: every time I choose a leet level it uses the selected minus 1. ie, I select 4, uses 3.

title: I couldn't live without it
comment: Best Android implementation of PasswordMaker!

title: Good, but usernames are difficult
comment: This is the best PWM app I've seen for Android and may beat out the website. However, like most of the apps here, it puts the username in the profile instead of letting me use different ones for different sites.

You can now edit the Username in the main screen.  You just have to enable it in the Settings.  Its optional because some phones have very limited amount of space to add other fields without scrolling.

title: What happened
comment: After the update passwords are not correct.   Cannot generate correct default passwords
This is now been fixed.  It was an issue in it not finding a profile automatically properly.
Passwords are incorrect, not usable anymore.
This is now been fixed. It was an issue in it not finding a profile automatically properly.

title: Used to be great
comment: I have no idea why this app was updated it is now a user interface nightmare, buggy as hell and doesn't even generate the correct passwords any more, at least not with sha1

title: Great app
comment: Reinstall to fix password generation problem introduced with update from around 7/19/2014

title: Doesn't work after update
comment: I've used this on my phone for years and now it will not generate the right passwords. Something in the update screwed up the settings. This so no longer generates the same passwords that the web version does.

title: Great update in need of tweaks
comment: This app has served me well for several years. It is nice to see it updated with a modern look. It took me a while to figure out how to manually select a  profile (long press). It could use a few visual hints. Great update. Thanks for a great app.

title: Great app
comment: I tried quite a few PasswordMaker apps and this is the one I settled on. Simple and easy to use which is all I could ask for.

title: No permissions requested
comment: Wow. What a pleasant surprise. No special permissions required and none requested.

title: Chand
comment: Mandil
Use this all the time

title: Doesn't generate same as Chrome extension
comment: The app does everything the Chrome extension does, which is awesome! But it doesn't generate the same password! So it's kind of useless?! Or am I missing something here?!

title: A solid Android version
comment: This app does a solid job at providing the mobile user with the PasswordMaker experience.  The main page gives you all the right info you need for the given URL.  The profile change page manages the complex settings well.  The biggest issue I had was that there is no way to cancel our of profile changes you may not want to keep.  Once changed you are stuck with it.  That could lead to problems down the line.  The other big issue I had was the difficulty just seeing the custom char set without changing it.

title: no sync
comment: There aren't any options to import/export/sync settings. It's a hassle to get it to generate the same passwords as the Firefox extension, etc.

title: Great
comment: I like it more than the original password maker app. More user friendly. Generates the smart password as my Firefox extension. Can't live without them. I sleep better at night knowing my passwords are strong, unique and hard to crack
Spot on

title: Nice
comment: Good thanks

title: Includes Saving urls
comment: Being able to save URLs is the killer feature for me. Plus nice UI for the profile preferences screen puts this ahead of the original android port.

title: Bug renders useless
comment: Generates incorrect passwords for some sites.

title: Can't edit profile
comment: Won't save changes to profile even when adding a new one, always reverts algorithm to SHA1. Nexus S.

title: Need ability to import profiles
comment: I've been waiting for a passwordmaker app for my phone that can import my .rdf profile from firefox.  I was hoping this one could, but apparently not.  When that happens it's 5 stars for sure.  I love passwordmaker, and can't wait to be able to use it on my phone.

title: Best Android Implimentation
comment: Better than "passwordmaker" app. Works great on Nexus Galaxy and ICS.
Creates the same wrong password for several urls, if you can't rely on it then what's the point?
Love it, keep up the good work!

title: Excellent
comment: Works exactly as advertised
